ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Re: Playing Where's Waldo in Shar Vahl
ygData.msgSnippet: Well Muse is selling the PDF format of his maps if you wanna use his or do Like I do and print up all the ones he has directly from the sight  by running your
ygData.messageBody:
Well Muse is selling the PDF format of his maps if you wanna use his or do
Like I do and print up all the ones he has directly from the sight by
running your cursor over what you want printed and then setting your printer
to print the highlighted areas

Halyburton
----- Original Message -----
From: "Su" <suceress@...>


>
> Oh, the maps that came with the game were some of my biggest pet peeves.
> They made no sense to me. I asked /ooc if they looked even remotely like
the
> city (to people who had been exploring) and was told "No". And then they
> sold that map booklet that is almost useless. Especially with some of the
> errors. Like having A B C D E listed on the map but only A B C D defined.
So
> there's this zone that's marked but not defined... The person who did EQ
> Atlas did a MUCH better job at maps. His maps are much much more useful. I
> really wish he hadn't gotten screwed on the map book thingy. I would've
> payed for a book with his maps over the one Sony put out. I still think it
> would be cool if he made a book and had fold out maps and such. Ones that
> are large enough to mark things on as notes to yourself. So you can look
at
> them ingame and out of game.
> luv,
> -Su
